metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized November 7, 2025 - Enhanced CAN-07 guidance, specialized task keywords

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (show pending invitations), constraints (prioritize based on customer meetings and product strategy), and timeframe (this week).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify key entities like 'pending invitations', 'prioritize', 'customer meetings', 'product strategy', and 'this week'.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events and invitations for the specified timeframe (this week) from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access the user's events and invitations before filtering pending ones.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events, including RSVP status, attendees, and other relevant details to identify pending invitations.
execution_plan.note: Critical for identifying which invitations are still pending and gathering details for prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, team sync) based on title, attendees, and context.
execution_plan.note: Required to identify customer meetings and product strategy sessions as per user priorities.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance of each pending invitation considering user-stated priorities (customer meetings and product strategy) and other contextual factors.
execution_plan.note: Determines which invitations should be prioritized based on user-defined priorities.

execution_plan.description: Generate a clear, user-friendly display of pending invitations and their priority ranking for this week.
execution_plan.note: Provides the requested 'show me' output in a visual or structured format for easy interpretation.

orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails, fallback to basic event list; if classification or importance assessment fails, return unprioritized pending invitations.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings this week—flag the ones I need to prep for, and put time on my calendar to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (flag important meetings, schedule prep time), constraints (this week), and actions (identify important meetings, allocate prep time).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language input.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current week to identify which meetings exist and their details.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to support importance assessment and prep estimation.
execution_plan.note: Foundational for downstream tasks like importance assessment and prep time estimation.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help determine which meetings are likely to require preparation.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to identify which ones are critical and need preparation.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with type classification; both outputs combined for final selection.

execution_plan.description: Estimate the amount of preparation time needed for each flagged important meeting based on complexity, attendees, and available materials.
execution_plan.note: Uses metadata and importance to determine realistic prep durations.

execution_plan.description: Check the user's calendar for free slots to schedule preparation time without creating conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Depends on calendar retrieval and prep time estimates.

execution_plan.description: Create new calendar events for preparation sessions in the identified available slots.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If importance assessment fails, fallback to meeting type classification only; if availability check fails, suggest manual scheduling.

compositions.prompt_text: Show me how my meeting time is broken down this month and where I could reclaim time to focus on product development.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: analyze meeting time breakdown for the current month and identify opportunities to reclaim time for product development.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract timeframe (this month) and optimization goal (focus on product development).

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current month to analyze time allocation.
execution_plan.note: Provides the raw data set of meetings for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer call) to understand how time is distributed across meeting categories.
execution_plan.note: Helps break down meeting time by category for visualization and optimization.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and necessity of each meeting to identify low-value meetings that could be reclaimed.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings are less critical and candidates for time reclamation.

execution_plan.description: Aggregate total time spent in meetings by category and importance to quantify time allocation patterns.
execution_plan.note: Provides statistical breakdown of meeting time for the month.

execution_plan.description: Generate visual charts and reports showing how meeting time is distributed and highlight areas where time can be reclaimed.
execution_plan.note: Fulfills the 'show me' requirement by presenting data visually and suggesting reclaimable time.

orchestration.error_handling: If classification or importance assessment fails, fallback to basic time aggregation and visualization.

compositions.prompt_text: Schedule my weekly 1:1 with Alex every Monday at 10am. If there's a conflict, auto-bump movable meetings.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring 1:1), constraints (weekly, Monday 10am), attendee (Alex), and conflict handling rule (auto-bump movable meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'Alex' to a specific contact in the user's directory to ensure correct attendee is invited.
Retrieve the user's calendar events for the relevant timeframe to check for conflicts and availability.
Extract metadata from existing events such as attendees, RSVP status, and whether meetings are marked as movable or fixed.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify which meetings can be bumped if conflicts occur.

execution_plan.description: Classify existing meetings by type (1:1, team sync, etc.) to help determine which meetings are movable versus fixed.
Assess the strategic importance and reschedulability of existing meetings to decide which can be bumped.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with CAN-02A after metadata extraction.

execution_plan.description: Check availability for Mondays at 10am across the user's calendar and Alex's calendar to confirm if the slot is free.
Apply scheduling constraints (weekly recurrence, Monday 10am) and availability data to determine if the meeting can be scheduled without conflicts.
If conflicts exist, resolve them by bumping movable meetings based on importance and type, as per user instruction.
execution_plan.note: Specialized task triggered by 'auto-bump movable meetings' instruction.

execution_plan.description: Generate the recurrence rule for the weekly meeting (every Monday at 10am).
Create the new recurring 1:1 event with Alex, applying the recurrence rule and adjusted schedule.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (CAN-02A) and step 6 (CAN-02B) can run in parallel after step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification. If conflict resolution fails, escalate to user for manual decision.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to focus this afternoon. Bump all movable meetings to tomorrow or later this week.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (focus this afternoon), constraints (move all movable meetings), and timeframe (this afternoon → tomorrow or later this week).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify scheduling actions.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for this afternoon and the rest of the week to identify which meetings need to be moved.
execution_plan.note: Required to know which meetings exist in the specified timeframe.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for each meeting such as RSVP status, attendees, and whether the meeting is marked as mandatory or optional to determine movability.
execution_plan.note: Enables assessment of which meetings can be rescheduled.

execution_plan.description: Classify meetings by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer call) to help determine which meetings are more flexible to move.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification helps in deciding movability.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to decide which ones can be postponed.
execution_plan.note: Subjective assessment ensures critical meetings remain untouched.

execution_plan.description: Check availability for tomorrow and later this week to find suitable slots for rescheduling the movable meetings.
execution_plan.note: Needed to ensure new times do not conflict with existing commitments.

execution_plan.description: Apply scheduling constraints to fit movable meetings into available slots while respecting user preferences and attendee availability.
execution_plan.note: Ensures all constraints are satisfied before rescheduling.

execution_plan.description: Handle any unsatisfiable constraints by prioritizing meetings and making trade-offs when necessary.
execution_plan.note: Critical for resolving conflicts when not all meetings can be perfectly rescheduled.

execution_plan.description: Update the calendar by moving the identified meetings to their new time slots.
execution_plan.note: Executes the actual rescheduling action.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If availability check fails, notify user; if constraint satisfaction fails, escalate with conflict resolution suggestions.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a team sync for next Tuesday at 2pm with Sarah, Mike, and the design team. Book the large conference room and prioritize this over non-customer meetings if there's a conflict.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule a team sync), constraints (next Tuesday at 2pm), attendees (Sarah, Mike, design team), resource requirement (large conference room), and priority rule (prioritize over non-customer meetings).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language input.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names (Sarah, Mike) and expand 'design team' into individual members from the directory.
Retrieve user's calendar events for the relevant timeframe (next Tuesday and surrounding slots) to check for conflicts and availability.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as meeting type, attendees, and importance to support prioritization and conflict resolution.
execution_plan.note: Enables downstream tasks like classification and conflict handling.

execution_plan.description: Classify existing meetings by type (e.g., customer vs non-customer) to apply the prioritization rule.
Assess the strategic importance of existing meetings to determine which can be deprioritized if conflicts arise.
Check availability of all resolved attendees for next Tuesday at 2pm.
Apply scheduling constraints (time, attendees, priority rules) to determine if the requested meeting can be scheduled as is.
If conflicts exist, resolve them by deprioritizing non-customer meetings as per user instruction and reschedule or bump them if necessary.
execution_plan.note: Handles prioritization and conflict resolution logic.

execution_plan.description: Book the large conference room for the scheduled meeting.
Create the new team sync event with confirmed time, attendees, and booked resource.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 5 and 6 could run in parallel after metadata extraction (step 4)
orchestration.error_handling: If resource booking fails, notify user and suggest alternatives; if conflict resolution fails, escalate for manual intervention.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull together a prep agenda for my customer pitch on Friday, including recent work updates from the team.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create prep agenda), identify target meeting (customer pitch), date (Friday), and additional requirements (include recent work updates from the team).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the specified timeframe (Friday) to locate the customer pitch meeting and any related events.
Classify retrieved events to confirm which one is a customer meeting (customer pitch) based on title, attendees, and context.
Extract metadata for the identified customer pitch meeting, including attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes to inform agenda creation.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and agenda generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments or pre-reads linked to the customer pitch meeting for inclusion in the prep agenda.
Analyze recent collaboration patterns and documents to identify recent work updates from the team relevant to the customer pitch.
execution_plan.note: Needed to fulfill the requirement of including recent work updates.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured prep agenda document for the customer pitch meeting, incorporating meeting details, retrieved documents, and recent team updates.
execution_plan.note: Final step to produce the requested prep agenda.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (Document Retrieval) and step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with agenda using available metadata and updates; if work attribution fails, include placeholder section for updates.

compositions.prompt_text: Pull a briefing doc for my 1:1 with Jamie tomorrow, including what we've been working on.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (generate briefing doc), meeting identifier (1:1 with Jamie), and timeframe (tomorrow).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the specified timeframe (tomorrow) to locate the 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
Classify retrieved events to confirm which one is a 1:1 meeting with Jamie.
execution_plan.note: Ensures correct identification of the meeting type (1:1).

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the identified meeting: attendees, RSVP status, attachments, notes, and any linked documents.
execution_plan.note: Foundational step to enable document retrieval and briefing generation.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve any existing attachments, pre-reads, or shared documents linked to the meeting.
execution_plan.note: Provides source material for the briefing document.

execution_plan.description: Analyze past meetings and collaboration patterns with Jamie to identify what projects or tasks you've been working on together.
execution_plan.note: Enables inclusion of 'what we've been working on' in the briefing.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing document that includes meeting details, retrieved documents, and a summary of recent collaborative work.
execution_plan.note: Final output: a formatted briefing document for the 1:1 meeting.

parallelization_opportunities: step 5 (Document Retrieval) and step 6 (Work Attribution Discovery) can run in parallel after step 4
orchestration.error_handling: If document retrieval fails, proceed with briefing using available metadata and collaboration summary; retry failed retrievals asynchronously.

compositions.prompt_text: Create a summary of all team meetings this quarter and what we accomplished.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (create summary), timeframe (this quarter), meeting scope (team meetings), and output requirement (accomplishments).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events within the specified timeframe (this quarter) from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Needed to gather raw meeting data for the quarter.

execution_plan.description: Classify retrieved meetings by type to identify which ones are 'team meetings'.
execution_plan.note: Ensures only team meetings are included in the summary.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata such as attendees, notes, and any attached documents from the identified team meetings.
execution_plan.note: Provides the content needed to determine accomplishments and context.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured summary document of all team meetings and what was accomplished, using extracted metadata and notes.
execution_plan.note: Creates the final deliverable summarizing accomplishments.

orchestration.error_handling: If metadata extraction fails for some meetings, proceed with available data and flag incomplete sections in the summary.
